description: Singapore has one of the fastest ageing population in Asia and ageing populations are an international phenomenon. To prepare for an aged society, there is a need to understand the wide breadth and complex nature of ageing which impacts the health, physical, functional, social, psychological and economic aspects of older persons. This module introduces ageing population and its increasing relevance for health, social and economic planning and policy, in Singapore and internationally. Demographgy of ageing, normal and abnormal ageing, common ageing-related diseases, health and social services and policies, and medico-legal and ethical issues of care for older persons are included.
title: Health in the Later Years
department: SSH School of Public Health Dean's Office
